oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Taylor Jefferson (T. J.) Box with banjo
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: T.J. Box is pictured standing and playing a banjo. He has a guitar over his right shoulder, and has a harmonica on a stand around his neck. Box acquired his first banjo when he was ten or eleven years old.

During the course of his life, Box pursued agricultural work, migrant work, work in a canning plant, and life insurance. His travels took him to California, Florida, Alabama, and Arkansas. Born in Lawrence County, Tennessee, he would eventually come back to the state of his birth and reside in the Blue Goose Community, outside Lexington, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Parks Folklife Project Collection, 1979-1984
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Banjo; Harmonica; Guitar
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Orr, Jay;
